title.narrative: EQUIPPED FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES FOR CP

description.narrative: By 2023 families and communities are equipped to protect their children, especially the most vulnerable, from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect, including in emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023 families and communities are equipped to protect their children, especially the most vulnerable, from violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect, including in emergencies.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported 4,395 village solidarity groups in 12 provinces resulting in an improved protective environment for 124,439 vulnerable children (including 81,778 girls). The Ministry of Social affairs' capacities was strengthened in setting up and training 481 child protection committees in seven provinces with 672 members. 165,899 community members received messages on good parenting and prevention of child abuse and exploitation. Thanks to a broad range of partnerships at community level with NGOs, the percentage of villages that have adopted positive childrearing practices was increased from 34% in 2018 to 73% in 2019. NGO partners included SOJPAE, UCBUM, FVS/AMADE. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019
